raw_comment: Looking at this graph notice how in some places a lot more younger people think the world is getting better than those over 40, but I wonder why it is not vice versa. I relate to this graph in the sense that in the U.S. people are being more supportive and inclusive of others. I think a catchy headline for this graph would be "Where is the World Going"
ace_sentences: In some places, many younger people think that the world is getting better.
In some places, fewer people over 40 think that the world is getting better.
I wonder why the opposite is not true.
In the U.S., people are more supportive of other people.
In the U.S., people are more inclusive of other people.
The headline is: Where is the World Going.
